name: South-Florida - suburbs - night.WAV
description: This is a soundsample of a town at night. Its not recorded but made of many different sounds. You will hear some crickets, frogs, a dog and some distant traffic. I researched on cricket species and found some wav-files of those species who live around South-Florida in real life, so the nightchorus is somewhat identical with the real! Enjoy! Insect sounds are from this site: http://www.entnemdept.ufl.edu/walker/buzz/ I encourage you not to use this sound in projects and sounds that maybe are going to be sold due to copyright issues that could occur by doing so. Non-commercial use only.

name: Town or suburbs amb - summer night.WAV
description: This is a sound of crickets singing on a summernight in a town or in the suburbs. It's not directly recorded, but made of different sounds. I tried to make a realistic Hollywood night sound with crickets as they really sound in Southern California. So I found an easy on-line field guide of cricket species of the US. Then I checked some different common cricket species and saw a map of where they occur. Then I found out that this site, also had real recordings of those crickets occurring in Southern California or elsewhere. So I downloaded the right species and mixed them together and added a bit of background traffic and wind, and even a dog barking for more realism. It was actually really easy!!! So the result is a sound of the real cricket species that live in California. Perfect for hollywood films where night scenes are included!!! ALSO: When you use this for a film, soundtrack or something, I would very much like to see/hear it. Write a comment with a link here!Enjoy!!! :D I encourage you not to use this sound in projects and sounds that maybe are going to be sold due to copyright issues that could occur by doing so.

name: Tuesday Morning on the Shore.aif
description:
I set my iPod on top of the box fan in my living room window, facing out the window of my 8th floor apartment. My building is L shaped, concrete & 15 stories. My unit is near the junction of the two wings. There is a sizable courtyard & a small lawn with trees. Between the building/courtyard & the road, there is a parking lot about 40 or 50 yards deep. Then there is the quieter end of one of the busiest streets in our city.

 The birds were particularly vocal that morning & traffic seemed minimal. So I recorded. 

 The audio has been amplified & minimal equalization has been applied 
 ( high/low shelf reduction <2db, boost @ 3k <2db )

name: San Francisco Traffic at Powell And O'Farrell
description:
This is the sound of traffic at a busy intersection in San Francisco, one block south of Union Square. You can hear the sounds of tires running over the cable car tracks and the constant running of the cable itself, under the tracks. You can also hear a lot of foot track, mainly tourists, crossing the street. 

Recorded using a Zoom H4n and Rode NTG-2 on a bright, spring day. Recorded to accompany a friends street photography exhibit.

name: mab-traffic-mkh800-ms.wav
description:
This recording is part of the microphone-comparison-traffic-wav
sample pack. 

The three samples in this series were recorded simultaneously (from
approximately the same position) with three different standard stereo
microphone arrangements: mid-side (mixed into L-R), X-Y cardioid, and
with a Jecklin disk.

The 2'40" recordings capture automobile traffic passing from right to left
and left to right directly in front of the microphone
on a country road in New Jersey (USA) on September 9, 2006.  There
is considerable ambient sound audible, mostly from a proliferation of crickets.

This recording was made with a pair of Sennheiser MKH-800
microphones in a mid-side configuration (inside a Rycote blimp).
The "mid" microphone was set to "wide cardioid" and the "side"
was set to "figure-8" and connected to a Sound Devices 744T
digital recorder at 96K/24bits.

name: AMBTraf_Calm City traffic.Clean.Distance 200m.Park.Autumn.Evening_EM
description: This was a small series of sound recordings, the purpose of which was to capture pure calm traffic, from various distances and without accompanying activity (voices, pedestrians, dogs, etc.) It was recorded in a warm late autumn, in a quiet, evening park, in damp weather. The recorder was moved as it recorded closer to the wet road at the edge of the park. In general, five successful takes out of five were made, from distances of 200, 100, 50, 25, 5 meters (approximately). This is recording from a distance 200m. Recorded November 14, 2023 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing. See recordings from other distances in the folder Ambience.Traffic https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/34346/ See more field recordings in folders: Ambience.Misc https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/34344/ Ambience.Park https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/33114/ Ambience.Birdsong https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/38584/ Ambience.Forest https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/35656/ Ambience.Grassland https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/35654/ Birds https://freesound.org/people/newlocknew/packs/33110/

name: mab-traffic-nt4-xy.wav
description:
This recording is part of the microphone-comparison-traffic-wav
sample pack. 

The three samples in this series were recorded simultaneously (from
approximately the same position) with three different standard stereo
microphone arrangements: mid-side (mixed into L-R), X-Y cardioid, and
with a Jecklin disk.

The 2'40" recordings capture automobile traffic passing from right to left
and left to right directly in front of the microphone
on a country road in New Jersey (USA) on September 9, 2006.  There
is considerable ambient sound audible, mostly from a proliferation of crickets.

This recording was made with a Rode NT4 X-Y stereo microphone (with
a Rycote "Windjammer") connected to a Marantz PMD-671 digital
recorder at 96K/24bits.

name: hand-operated cable ferry underwater river 1543 220726_0459
description: Hand operated cable/chain ferry across small Dommel river in ‘s-Hertogenbosch, the Netherlands. See picture to see position hydrophones. In background the peoples voices and traffic on low level. About the ferry; There is a hand-operated cable ferry connecting the nature reserve with the ‘s-Hertogenbosch mid-level city wall. You have to turn the wheel to drive the ferry. This small ferry forms a link in a walking route along the outside of the old fortified city of Den Bosch. The old nickname of the fortress was chosen as the name for the ferry: de Moerasdraak 'the Swamp Dragon'. More recordings today / More hydrophone recordings Date/time: July 26th 2022, 15:43 PM Location; cable ferry Dommel river, Vughterweg, ‘s-Hertogenbosch (Den Bosch), Noord-Brabant, Netherlands (Holland), Europe. name: Traffic- Decameron.m4a
description: This is a loose interpretation of our first Audio Image assignment, which was to record an Audio Image of traffic that sounds different than American traffic. I decided to do a recording of human traffic, recording the atmosphere and people walking by me as I sat for a breather at an outdoor nightclub. This is unique to Europe firstly because outdoor nightclubs are not very popular at all in America and I have never been to one in America before, and secondly because the variance in languages making up this sonic image is unlike anything I've heard at an American nightclub.

name: R4_00531_FR_Traffic-in-town.wav
description:
Traffic in town in the afternoon. 
I made this recording from a 3rd floor balcony located in Cruseilles (haute-Savoie, France) around 4PM. 
Here, one can hear traffic and general atmosphere in a small town, in the afternoon. The nearby church-bell will ring 4 times at 0’56’’ and 2’56’’. 
Recorded in August 2023 with a Centrance MixerFace R4R and Rycote OM-08 stereo pair in AB position (about 30cm apart). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 30Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: hand-operated cable ferry 344PM 220726_0459.wav
description: Hand operated cable/chain ferry across small Dommel river in ‘s-Hertogenbosch, the Netherlands. See picture to see position hydrophones. In background the peoples voices and traffic on low level. About the ferry; There is a hand-operated cable ferry connecting the nature reserve with the ‘s-Hertogenbosch mid-level city wall. You have to turn the wheel to drive the ferry. This small ferry forms a link in a walking route along the outside of the old fortified city of Den Bosch. The old nickname of the fortress was chosen as the name for the ferry: de Moerasdraak 'the Swamp Dragon'. More recordings today / More hydrophone recordings Date/time: July 26th 2022, 15:15 pm Location; cable ferry Dommel river, Vughterweg, ‘s-Hertogenbosch (Den Bosch), Noord-Brabant, Netherlands (Holland), Europe. name: Sitar Synth Car Sound 3.wav
description: I recently contributed a track to a Triple LP set of krautrock cover versions ("Head Music 2", released by Fruits De Mer Records, December 2020). The song I chose to cover was Kraftwerk's "Autobahn". If you know the track, you'll know that it uses synthesised traffic sounds alongside recordings of the same. On my version, I achieved these in three ways: 1) I downloaded some public domain traffic sound effects from elsewhere here on freesound.org (thanks, guys!) 2) I got in my car with my Zoom recorder and made my own recordings of the engine starting, stopping, etc 3) I made my own sound effects using virtual synths and effects in Ableton Live 10 This particular sound falls into the third category. Let me stress that while the song "Autobahn" is copyrighted, these are isolated sound effects and are not covered by copyright. I'm making them available here under a public domain licence. If you download and use any of these samples, please let me know in the comments what you did with them. It's not compulsory but it would be interesting to know what people did with these sounds.

On my version, I achieved these in three ways: 1) I downloaded some public domain traffic sound effects from elsewhere here on freesound.org (thanks, guys!) 2) I got in my car with my Zoom recorder and made my own recordings of the engine starting, stopping, etc 3) I made my own sound effects using virtual synths and effects in Ableton Live 10 This particular sound falls into the third category. Let me stress that while the song "Autobahn" is copyrighted, these are isolated sound effects and are not covered by copyright. I'm making them available here under a public domain licence. If you download and use any of these samples, please let me know in the comments what you did with them. It's not compulsory but it would be interesting to know what people did with these sounds.

name: AMBTraf_Traffic City Evening Binaural 01_KVV AUDIO_FREE
description: Description: A binaural recording of city traffic in the evening. The sound features the steady flow of cars passing by, with varying engine tones, occasional honks, and the soft hum of distant vehicles. Subtle urban ambience, including faint footsteps, distant conversations, and the muffled rustling of leaves. Captures the calm yet dynamic atmosphere of a city winding down for the night. Ideal for immersive urban scenes, background ambience, or cinematic soundscapes. Recorded May 15 , 2024 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing. Location: Ekaterinburg. Russia. Iset river. Plotinka. Makarovskiy bridge. name: Xalet de la Trinitat.wav
description:
This montage sound starts from the soundscape of the acoustic environment of the Xalet de la Trinitat Nova, a building next to the Parc Natural de Collserola. With a tonic background sound from the noise of the Meridiana and Ronda de Dalt traffic engines, this recording features sounds of birdsong in the foreground. In addition, a neighbor explains the migration processes that came to the neighborhood at the time of its creation.

Recorded with Zoom H5.

Aquest muntatge sonor parteix del paisatge sonor de l'entorn acústic del Xalet de la Trinitat Nova, edifici a tocar del Parc Natural de Collserola. Amb un so tònic de fons del soroll dels motors del trànsit de la Meridiana i la Ronda de Dalt, aquest enregistrament presenta sons de cants d'ocells a primer pla. A més, un veí explica els processos de migració que van arribar al barri en el moment de la seva creació.

Sons enregistrats amb gravadora Zoom H5.

name: AMBPark_Winter.Dark Evening.Traffic.Passers-by.Dist Construction Site 1_EM
description:
Sound recording of the urban soundscape, made in a vacant lot located on the outskirts of the park. It was a dark, winter evening. Everything around is covered with snow, which absorbs all sounds very well. Right in front of us, 200m away, there is a road with leisurely traffic. Behind the road, 350-400 meters away, you can hear the noise of a construction site and hammer blows, which are reflected from nearby buildings. To the sides and straight ahead we hear the distant voices of passers-by.
Recorded in park, named after the 50th anniversary of the All-Union Lenin Communist Youth Union in the city of Ekaterinburg (Russia)
Recorded January , 2024 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing.

name: Steel bridge noise city (Diezebrug) NL 180512_1262.flac
description: Ambient recording under steel bridge. (picture by Zanaq, thanks to MaanMeis, wikimedia) Above me is the steel Diezebrug with different traffic (cars bikes, scooters and trucks. On the right the river 'Dieze'. The construction gives a nice and deep rumbling noise resonance. Several boats cross the river, some of them with tourists. For me the old factory of 'Koudijs'. Here are now several small companies located. THE VIEW FROM UNDER THE BRIDGE This iron and steel bridge is located in the city of 's-Hertogenbosch in The Netherlands and was built in 1939. Several boats cross the river, some of them with tourists. For me the old factory of 'Koudijs'. Here are now several small creative companies located. People sometime audible on that location. Date/time: May 12th Saturday 2018, start 12.41 pm afternoon Weather: 21c, partly clouded, wind SE 2bft with gusts to 22 kmh, 1015 hPa, humidity 35%. Location; Buitendijk / Havendijk under Diezebrug, ‘s-Hertogenbosch (Den Bosch), Noord-Brabant, Netherlands (Holland), Europe. name: New Zealand Pedestrian Traffic Signal
description: This is a recording of the New Zealand pedestrian crossing signal. For a digitally generated recreation, go to https://freesound.org/s/474366/. *** New Zealand uses ‘Audible Tactile Traffic Signals’ at almost all of their light-controlled pedestrian crossings to aid visual- and hearing-impaired pedestrians, letting them know when the pedestrian light is green and it’s safe to cross. There are two parts to the audible component: the locating signal and the crossing signal. The locating signal assists vision-impaired people in finding the pedestrian push-button. This “consists of a short pip (25 ms of 1000 Hz square wave) repeating every 1.8 seconds.” (NZTA Road Traffic Standards) The crossing signal indicates that the pedestrian crossing signal is green and that the pedestrians may cross. This consists of a square wave which “descends exponentially in pitch from 3,500 Hz to 700 Hz over 115 ms. This is immediately followed by a rapidly pulsing sinusoidal 500 Hz signal that decays over 35 ms, before ceasing momentarily and being repeated at 8.5 times a second for the duration of the cross signal.” (NZTA Road Traffic Standards) The volume of the audible signal responds to ambient sound levels. i.e. When nearby traffic is louder, the signal is louder, but when the environment is quiet, signal noise is lowered accordingly. Recorded with a Zoom H4n Pro in Auckland, New Zealand.

name: AMBUrbn_Spring.Dark alley.Midnight.Dist bell.Traffic.Passersby.Barking.Dripping.Cars_EM
description: Nature is rebelling against man. Abnormal weather in our region. Wet snow fell yesterday (100 mm). Trees are breaking under his weight. The temperature then drops below 0 Degrees Celsius, then rises to +20C. The snow melts and immediately freezes, turning sidewalks and roads into a crunchy ice rink. Sound recording of city noise in an alley in the dark late at night, around midnight. The background noise of traffic is cut by distant passing cars. Meltwater drips from the roof of the nearest building. Infrequent bell strikes are faintly heard, on the eve of the Orthodox Easter holiday. People pass by with their pets. One of the pets saw me from afar and started barking warningly. Cars drive through the alley on dirty snowmelt and water. It's Sunday, May 05, I'm sitting and writing all this, and it's snowing again outside the window. Recorded May 04 , 2024 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing. Location: Ekaterinburg City (Russia) I ask you, if possible, to help this wonderful site (not me) stay afloat and develop further. description:
Heavy traffic in town during late afternoon. 
I made this recording from a 3rd floor balcony located in Cruseilles (haute-Savoie, France) around 6PM. 
Here, one can hear quite heavy traffic and general atmosphere in a small town during the late afternoon. The nearby church-bell will ring 6 times at 8’21’’ and 10’21’’. 
Recorded in August 2023 with a Centrance MixerFace R4R and Rycote OM-08 stereo pair in AB position (about 30cm apart). 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 30Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

Zoom iQ7 Mid-Side Stereo Microphone
120° Stereo Width

name: Amb_Swed_City_Square_Traffic_Bus_1
description:
City Square with busy traffic during lunchtime.

Location: Sweden, Stockholm, Slussen

Recorded on SD Mixpre-3 I with 2 Schoeps MK 40 module with GVC Angle in a ORTF-setup.

In Pro Tools Studio added a Low cut 85 Hz to reduce the bass and cut a very small amount of low mid. My first impression is that the setup sounds quite warm and detailed. It captures the "feel" of the environment and adds its classic warm low energy. Maybe its just me but i perceive the setup to be somewhat unbalanced in its stereo image but not too much.

Fun test but I prefer using DPA (2011) in AB or ORTF because it captures a great deal of detail and yet balances it out with the low and highs.

There's a similar recording of the same place and setup in my profile "Amb_Swed_City_Square_Traffic_Bus_2". It's less active and more general, good for a more consistent and mellow background.

Hope it comes to some use for you!

name: Amb_Swed_City_Square_Traffic_Bus_2
description:
City Square with busy traffic during lunchtime.

Location: Sweden, Stockholm, Slussen

Recorded on SD Mixpre-3 I with 2 Schoeps MK 40 module with GVC Angle in a ORTF-setup.

In Pro Tools Studio added a Low cut 85 Hz to reduce the bass and cut a very small amount of low mid. My first impression is that the setup sounds quite warm and detailed. It captures the "feel" of the environment and adds its classic warm low energy. Maybe its just me but i perceive the setup to be somewhat unbalanced in its stereo image but not too much.

Fun test but I prefer using DPA (2011) in AB or ORTF because it captures a great deal of detail and yet balances it out with the low and highs.

There's a similar recording of the same place and setup in my profile "Amb_Swed_City_Square_Traffic_Bus_1". It has more activity and life.


Hope it comes to some use for you!

name: City Rain Falling On Plastic Sheet Kind Of Sounds Like A Crackling Fire 2-9-23.wav
description: Morning Zoom H1n recording of rain around 9am, city atmosphere. Previous I used an upside down broken cloths basket lined at the top with a plastic garbage can liner to catch the sound of snow falling a few weeks ago. Strangely enough spring like weather hit us in Michigan during the middle of our snow season, so we've had a lot of rain lately. I figured I'd try the same set-up I used for recording snow, but for rain instead. It was also trash day in our subdivision so you might hear some distant garbage trucks and the usual traffic hum of the Motor City ( The nick name for Detroit, MI). The rain hitting the plastic liner about 3 inches above the mic, sort of sounds like a crackling from a fire to me, which I thought was kind of cool. Besides editing out the beginning and end of the track, it's uncut. Not sure if I'll use it on my YouTube Channel, but you're more then welcomed to use it how you see fit. Just attribute myself & freesound.org in your creations.

name: Traffic_ambience.wav
description:
Pointing a shotgun mic while standing 15 meters away from a heavy traffic street. 

This record is part of a set of ambience recordings I collect and share. I hope they're useful for video and music production. 

The sound was recorded using a Sennheiser Me67 shotgun mic mounted in a MZW70 blimp windscreen with a MZH70 deadcat. I used a Saffire PRO 24 audio interface as a preamplifier and A/D converter, and a Tascam DR 100 MKII recorder to record the resulting SPDIF stream.

name: traffic road from a bridge#2
description:

Here trucks and cars passing.
Recorded by myself with Zoom H4.

My sounds are listed "licenced under the Creative Commons Attribution Non-Commercial" because I loathe finding my sounds sold as mobile phone rings or used by advertising executives BUT for all ARTISTIC PROJECTS you're welcome, just ask me !

name: Sitar Synth Car Sound 2.wav
description: I recently contributed a track to a Triple LP set of krautrock cover versions ("Head Music 2", released by Fruits De Mer Records, December 2020). The song I chose to cover was Kraftwerk's "Autobahn". If you know the track, you'll know that it uses synthesised traffic sounds alongside recordings of the same. On my version, I achieved these in three ways: 1) I downloaded some public domain traffic sound effects from elsewhere here on freesound.org (thanks, guys!) 2) I got in my car with my Zoom recorder and made my own recordings of the engine starting, stopping, etc 3) I made my own sound effects using virtual synths and effects in Ableton Live 10 This particular sound falls into the third category. Let me stress that while the song "Autobahn" is copyrighted, these are isolated sound effects and are not covered by copyright. I'm making them available here under a public domain licence. If you download and use any of these samples, please let me know in the comments what you did with them. It's not compulsory but it would be interesting to know what people did with these sounds.

name: 231005_2562_FR_Traffic_in_Paris.wav
description:
Traffic in Paris (binaural, please use headset for 3D effects). 
I made this recording during a warm autumn morning, just near a stoplight  bordering the crossing of several cobbled streets, in the surroundings of Cambronne metro station, in Paris (France). 
One can hear different vehicles (cars, motorcycles, mopeds, buses, trucks, as well as bicycles) passing by in the streets, honking at times, while some people are walking and chatting on the sidewalk. In the background, hum from the city, and sometimes, squeaking noise from the brakes of the metro stopping in the nearby outdoor subway station. Quite a typical Parisian atmosphere, in my opinion. 
Recorded in October 2023 with an Olympus LS-P4 and Ohrwurm 3D binaural microphones. 
Fade in/out and high pass filter at 60Hz -6dB/oct applied in Audacity. 
(If you want to use this sound as a mono audio file, you may have to delete one channel to avoid phase issues).

name: AMBUrbn_Under The City Bridge Over The river.Traffic noise.Splashes Of Water_EM.wav
description: Sound recording of perspective on city traffic noise under a large bridge over a river. Small waves beat against the walls of the bridge supports and pavement, and the sound reflected from the concrete arches is drowned in beautiful echoes. You can also hear a knock from the wheels of cars passing along the joints, which is also colored by reflections. Twice, old heavy trams roar past, resembling a passing airliner more than a tram. Recorded 28 September, 2023 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing Location: The so-called "Makarovsky Bridge" across the river "Iset" is in the city of Ekaterinburg, Russia. name: DayAmbienceTrafficBirdsMuttedLaughterPlane.mp3
description:
A recording made around Noon on the edge of a woods located right in the middle of a major midwestern university.  Throughout this entire recording, you'll hear the everpresent hum of heating and air conditioner units running.  You will also hear faint conversations and laughter of students as they walk to class, faint sounds from a nearby construction site, distant rumble of traffic, the distant droning of an airplane lazily floating through the April sky.  
     From time to time you will also hear the well known "beep...beep.....beep...." of a piece of heavy equipment backing up.

   However, despite all of the dominating background of man and his machines, nature comes through.  Since 
I was sitting on the edge of a fairly large woods which sits in the center of all of the concrete and glass and steel, the sweet singing of birds lasts throughout much of this recording.

Equipment used:  Zoom  H4N recorder using the INTERNAL stereo microphones set on 180 degrees for the greatest sound capture.

name: Douglas-Hart Nature Center, Mattoon, Coles County, IL, USA - Walking the Trails through Prairie and Woodlands
description: This is a field recording of sounds encountered while walking the system of trails at Douglas-Hart Nature Center. The site is just east of Mattoon, Illinois in Coles County, USA. This location is significant because of its tallgrass prairie and woodland habitats that provide sanctuary for a variety of native Illinois flora and fauna. The recording was done on a handheld stereo digital recorder with bidirectional microphones (the make and model is Zoom H1n). A handmade wind buffer of furry cloth was used over the microphones and secured with soft elastic. This recording took place on Monday, November 14, 2022 at approximately 1:30 p.m. The weather was clear, sunny, and 41 degrees Fahrenheit with occasional winds of 7 miles per hour. The sounds include rubber boots walking on gravel, walking on dry and wet leaves, walking on snow and ice, walking over wooden bridges, a walking stick meeting the ground, bird calls, traffic along adjacent highways Dewitt Avenue and Lerna Road, faraway sounds from a cement plant, wind blowing through the tree limbs, wind rustling through the prairie grasses, walking on soggy earth, a worker at the nature center using an electric hand drill, walking on pavement, a car door opening and closing, sniffling...

name: activated_env3.mp3
description: Sounds produced by the participants in the workshop of Partick McGinley and Paulo Raposo at the meeting aimed to activate sonorously a space, in this case the corner of Marroc street leading to the entrance to Hangar. name: 2020-04-11 morning.flac

name: 13-CorsoVittorioEmanuele-II-03-06-20.wav
description: Paesaggi da ascoltare is a Sound Art project dedicated to the study and documentation of soundscapes. The "sound walk" is the essential tool of the project. This track was recorded in the old town of Cosenza for the first sound walk of the project made the 03 June 2020 starting at 19:00. The track is a field recording of the soundscape of the old town: birds, far voices, far in the valley the traffic of the city, dog barking.
